snippet: An outspoken Peruvian opponent of illegal logging and three other native Asháninka community leaders were brutally slain in a remote region bordering Brazil, tribal authorities said Monday.
abstract: Tribal authorities in Peru say Edwin Chota, outspoken opponent of illegal logging, and three other native Ashaninka community leaders were brutally slain in region borderig Brazil.
lead_paragraph: An outspoken Peruvian opponent of illegal logging and three other native Asháninka community leaders were brutally slain in a remote region bordering Brazil, tribal authorities said Monday.

headline.main: Peru: 4 Opponents of Illegal Logging Are Found Dead
headline.print_headline: Peru: 4 Opponents of Illegal Logging Are Found Dead
